And also +1.

item.title: Ticket #2734 (Nonce confirmation not informative.) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Ideally, verb noun pairs would map to a sentence that has the verb and noun hardcoded. 

__('Are you sure you want to delete category %s')

The nouns and verbs need the context of the entire sentence for proper translation. Also, we should move the nonce decoder and AYS dialog code to a separate function so that plugin writers don't have to reproduce all of that when providing a custom check_admin_referer(). I have to cut-and-paste all of that stuff into the secure-admin plugin even though I just want to add one line to the top of the function.

item.title: Ticket #2824 (Can't send pingbacks: Invalid pingback URI) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Cannot duplicate on my server. If I submit blank or 0 to get_permalink(), I get ​http://example.com/2006/06/15//

No clue how you're getting that date... has to be something in get_permalink() that's screwing up.

item.title: true-cat-exclusion.diff attached to Ticket #2825
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2825 (Category Exclusion for real) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
Keywords changed

Attached patch true-cat-exclusion.diff ensures all posts in the excluded categories are excluded. It costs one query. This will help folks with asides or other kinds of multiple-loop systems.

item.title: Ticket #2825 (Category Exclusion for real) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: Query vars like "cat=-1" will exclude all posts with ONLY category 1. Posts severally categorized cannot be excluded by category.

item.title: Ticket #2824 (Can't send pingbacks: Invalid pingback URI) created
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
When sending pingbacks, WP 2.0.3 appears to be using an invalid pingback URI, as shown in the pingback.log. An excerpt:

Processing -- ​http://www.homelandstupidity.us/2006/02/13/fema-easy-to-defraud/ Page Linked To: ​http://www.homelandstupidity.us/2006/02/13/fema-easy-to-defraud/ Page Linked From: ​http://www.homelandstupidity.us/1970/01/01// Error.

Fault code: 16 : The source URI does not exist.

The correct source URI was ​http://www.homelandstupidity.us/2006/06/14/fraudulent-fema-aid-may-exceed-1-billion/ .

item.title: Ticket #2238 (Roles: Notification of posts to be published) updated
item.dc:creator: usayd
item.description: This sounds like a very important feature that I definately think should be a core part of WordPress. Is this not possible simply by using the code (or similar) which shows 'drafts' in the manage->posts section?

item.title: Ticket #2787 (New Method of storing and calculating cap2user and user2cap) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: As much as I want this, I agree with 2.2 milestone. Convoluted? No, it's simplicity! simple user2cap relationship table. If you want convolution, you'd stick capabilities and roles into a serialized usermeta array so that cap2user requires unserializing each user's cap/role array, figuring out which are roles and which are capabilities, mapping capabilities from the roles to the capabilities that the role has, and then searching each user's capabilities array (at a huge memory cost) to see who has the specified capability. You know, like we're currently doing. :-)

item.title: Ticket #2787 (New Method of storing and calculating cap2user and user2cap) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
Milestone changed

This is way too much for 2.1, pushing to 2.2. Regardless, it seems convoluted.

item.title: Ticket #2821 (RBL used for comment spam check gone) updated
item.dc:creator: evilzenscientist
item.description:
Any chance of making this an editable; multi-valued entry?

Obviously some UI impact - so maybe a 2.1 milestone.

Justification for this:

  • regional preferences (keep traffic local within geo)
  • spread the load across multiple RBL check services

item.title: frontpage_posts.diff attached to Ticket #2822
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #2822 (show_on_front kills post_type=post queries on home page) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
This came up when people tried using the Recent Posts widget on their blogs when show_on_front is set to 'page'. If it's safe to assume special queries like that will provide query args, the attached patch fixes it. For example, this code is broken before and fixed after the patch: 

<?php $r = new WP_Query('showposts=10'); ?>
<?php if ( $r->have_posts() ) : while ( $r->have_posts() ) : $r->the_post(); ?>
/* Loop stuff */
<?php endwhile; endif; ?>

item.title: Ticket #2775 (Ability for all users to add users with less capabilities) updated
item.dc:creator: ringmaster
item.description:
The new ideas we discussed sounded good.

Essentially, a new associative array would be formed that contains target information (what user is being edited, what role they're being set to, what action is being performed, etc) and standardized array keys (like "action", "target_user", etc.) and passed with calls to current_user_can() like:

current_user_can('edit_user', array('target_user'=>$target_user_id, ...))

A new hook will be added to the end of get_meta_cap() that will forward all of this data on to registered plugins. The plugins can then implement completely new security models, even ones based on the old level hierarchy.

This will also have the advantage of allowing the filtering of other caps for meta caps, which really enhances the capabilities of... er... capabilities.

Without a plugin, capability functionality will remain unchanged, but it's a great boon for WP as a CMS, and it should only be a few lines of change.

Plugins should be sure to filter for only the meta caps they need, otherwise some circular logic could be introduced (by calling current_user_can() with a meta cap from inside the hook sink for get_meta_cap).

item.title: Ticket #2821 (RBL used for comment spam check gone) updated
item.dc:creator: jabesse
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #2821 (RBL used for comment spam check gone) created
item.dc:creator: jabesse
item.description:
In WP 2.0.3, there is an option to check for open proxies. This is implemented with an RBL check at opm.blitzed.org. However, this RBL is now gone: ​http://lists.blitzed.org/pipermail/opm-announce/2006q2.txt

Blitzed should be replaced. I suggest spamhaus: sbl-xbl.spamhaus.org

item.title: Ticket #2820 (Problem with links after mysql server update at brinkster) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES will break WP. Backslash becomes a normal character rather than an escape character when that flag is set. This will cause queries to fail, as you have found out.
